com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.budget

Class BudgetItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main.MoneyLoss
      • com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.budget.BudgetItem

  • public class BudgetItem
extends MoneyLoss
    Class representing an item that should be tracked and budgeted regularly. Subclass of MoneyLoss

    • Constructor Detail

      • BudgetItem

        public BudgetItem(java.lang.String description,
                  double budgetAmount,
                  Frequency frequency,
                  java.util.Date startDate,
                  java.util.Date endDate,
                  boolean proratedStart,
                  Source source)
           throws BadBudgetInvalidValueException
        Constructor for a Budget Item
        Parameters:
        description - - description of the new item to be budgeted, cannot be null or empty
        budgetAmount - - the amount to allocate to this budget item per cycle, cannot be negative
        frequency - - the frequency for resets, if one time end must match start
        startDate - - when to begin considering this item as having started, cannot be null
        endDate - - when to stop this items consideration, if frequency one time must match start date
        proratedStart - - indicates if initial start amount should be prorated, can only be true if frequency is weekly, monthly, or TODO yearly
        source - - this budgetItem's source of funding, cannot be null
        Throws:
        BadBudgetInvalidValueException

    • Method Detail

      • verifyValues

        public static int verifyValues(Frequency frequency,
                               boolean proratedStart)
        Checks the values for validity specific to budget items. If an error is found returns an error code indicating which error, if not 0 is returned. Possible errors and the return code are: 0 - Values are valid 1 - Prorated start is true but frequency is not valid for a prorated start.
        Parameters:
        frequency - - frequency of a budget item
        proratedStart - - prorated start status of a potential budget item
        Returns:
        an error code inidcating an error or 0 if no error was found

      • getPredictData

        public PredictDataBudgetItem getPredictData(int dayIndex)
        Returns the PredictData at dayIndex for this budget item
        Overrides:
        getPredictData in class MoneyLoss
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the date as an index off the starting date in the prediction algorithm
        Returns:
        the predict data row at the given index (corresponds to the data on a specific date for this budget item)

      • update

        public void update(int dayIndex,
                   boolean autoReset)
        After running the prediction algorithm this method updates this budget item's next withdrawal date to the value it would have on the day represented by day index. Also if auto reset is set this method sets the current amount for this budget item based on if a loss occurs during the period specified taking into account the remain action of this item. TODO 10/10, This is implying that a budget item is matched with a budget for its reset values, may want to resolve this conflict
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the day, as an offset from the start date used in the prediction algorithm, to update this budget items values to.
        autoReset - - specifies if this budget item should be reset on updates.

      • updateNextDatesOnly

        public void updateNextDatesOnly(int dayIndex,
                                boolean autoReset)
        This method uses the results of a prediction algorithm run to update the next dates of this budget item. If auto reset is set it also updates the remaining amount of this budget item looking at losses that occurred on days throughout the prediction run and also considering the remain action of the budget item. A remain action of addBack is not valid for a budget item if this method is being called and the behavior in this case is undefined.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the day to update our budget item to
        autoReset - - specifies if this budget item should be reset on updates.
